Chicken Fried Rice by Ashton Chiang

Ingredients

  • 1 chicken thigh
  • Cooked, chilled rice
  • 2 eggs
  • Broccoli and green onions
  • Freshly-minced garlic
  • Soy sauce
  • Salt
  • Pepper
  • Butter

Instructions

  1. Slice the chicken breast in half like a butterfly, and slice into desirable sized pieces.
  2. Season chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Crack the two eggs into a bowl and scramble them well.
  4. Turn heat on medium heat and melt a small pat of butter on the pan.
  5. Scramble the eggs in the pan and transfer them to a separate plate, and just let it vibe on the side.
  6. Wipe the pan off and turn the heat on medium to high. The key to cooking Chinese food is using high heat.
  7. Melt some more butter on the pan and add the chicken.
  8. Add the garlic and broccoli and saute.
  9. Then turn the burner to high heat. Scooch the veggies over to one side of the pan, melt the remaining butter in the other half, and add the chilled rice, soy sauce, and scrambled eggs. Then stir to combine with the veggies and continue saut√©ing the rice, stirring every 15-20 seconds or so for 3 minutes, or until you notice the rice and veggies starting to brown slightly.
  10. Remove the pan from heat and stir in the green onions.
  11. Dish it up and it's ready to serve!
